description:
OUR GOAL

We wanted to make a convenient cup of coffee that not only tastes great, but is better for the planet. Like all of our brands, Rise was built in collaboration with a charity partner, so our coffee can give back at every point along its journey. To further our commitment to the environment, we are proud to support the efforts of Pure Earth, an international organization that cleans up toxic pollution in developing countries across the world.

We pack only the top 2% of Arabica beans into our c-pods.

THE BEGINNING

To create Rise, we started by sustainably sourcing our beans, and then partnered with an American roaster who is committed to reducing the waste they generate throughout the manufacturing process. They recycle byproducts that would otherwise go to a landfill, and turn excess heat from the roasting process into usable energy, rather than releasing it into the environment.

Pure Earth partners with local communities to clean up toxic sites and guard against future pollution.

WORKING TOWARDS A PURE EARTH

We worked hard to make the best decisions possible at every point along the way while creating Rise Coffee, and we don’t think that work should stop when our coffee reaches you. Rise is committed to a healthy planet, and we wanted to do more for the environment than sustainably manufacture our coffee. We wanted to reverse the effects of existing pollution, and so we partnered with the experts at Pure Earth. Contaminated sites are an unpublicized but widespread problem, affecting more than 200 million people worldwide—a number similar to those affected by malaria, HIV/AIDS, and tuberculosis. Women and children are especially vulnerable, sometimes suffering brain damage or an early death as a result. From abandoned mines to the poisonous components released while recycling electronics, dangerous pollutants are a fact of life in many third-world communities. But it doesn’t have to be that way. Pure Earth works with local citizens and authorities to clean up existing sites and educate the public to prevent future hazards. So far, Pure Earth has improved 80 sites, affecting more than 4 million people—including 800,000 children younger than six.

To date, Pure Earth has restored sites in 20 countries, making life better for 4.2 million people.

At Greater Goods, we believe in manufacturing our products responsibly, and using a portion of the profits to support organizations working to build a better world. Visit PUREEARTH.ORG to learn more about the work Rise supports, or keep reading below to learn how our other brands give back.
name: rise
shortDescription: We love how single-serve coffee makes our mornings a little bit easier. We don’t love that existing single-serve options brew coffee in plastic, robbing it of flavor and creating trash that goes straight to a landfill. We began to wonder if we could make a quick cup of coffee that not only tastes great, but is better for the planet.
tagline: COFFEE WITH A CONSCIENCE <small>HOW RISE COFFEE IS HELPING THE PLANET</small>
tileDescription: Rise makes craft single-serve coffee that is good for the planet. Through our partnership with Pure Earth, each order helps to continue their work cleaning up toxic pollution around the world.

name: balance
shortDescription: Managing your health requires keeping track of a lot of different numbers, and we found that the devices you use to take those measurements can make the process even more complicated. We wanted to create easy-to-use tools that would help you monitor your health. Then, we went looking for a charity partner who could help us use a portion of each purchase to support the well-being of someone else in need.
tagline: get healthy, give back<small>Take Care of Yourself and Those in Need</small>
description:
WHAT IS BALANCE?

When we created Balance, we wanted to find a way to help you look after your health while also supporting the well-being of others. All of our health and wellness brands were built in collaboration with Love146, a non-profit dedicated to ending child trafficking. With your help, we can give back a portion of every purchase to help fight this tragic problem.

All Balance products are made at this factory in Zhongshan, China.
After we started our partnership, we visited the factory to tour their new facilities.

CREATED FOR GOOD

Balance is our line of non-connected devices that help you check in on a variety of health metrics. We’ve found that taking care of yourself requires dedication, backed up with data. It means paying attention to patterns, and the way your numbers change over time. Monitoring all this information at home can be difficult, though, without the right tools. We wanted to make well-designed products that would guide you easily through this process. To bring our designs to life, we partnered with factories that treat their workers well, paying decent wages and maintaining a safe, clean environment on the job. Like everything we make at Greater Goods, we wanted to make sure that Balance products contribute to a better world at every point along their journey.

Love146 offers prevention programs that educate children about the warning signs of exploitation.

GIVING BACK

Then, we went looking for a charity partner who could help us use a part of every purchase for good. When we met the founders of Love146, we were immediately inspired by their approach. Love146 provides long-term care for survivors of child trafficking across the world, creating a community that supports them as they build new lives. Love146 treats every child with dignity, making sure not to take advantage of the tragedy in their stories to attract donations. But they didn’t want to stop with survivor care—they wanted to find a way to end child trafficking for good. Today, Love146 also operates prevention programs that educate children in vulnerable situations about the warning signs of exploitation.

Love146 operates several group homes for survivors, like this one in the Philippines.

We’re passionate about creating products that will improve your life, and sharing a portion of the proceeds with charity partners that can improve the lives of others. Read more stories like this and shop the full range of Balance products below.
tileDescription: Balance helps you take charge of your health while caring for those in need. Both of our wellness brands collaborate with Love146, a charity that is fighting against child trafficking.

name: nourish
shortDescription: Preparing a healthy meal is about treating yourself well, but we’ve found that the wrong kitchen tools can turn cooking into a frustrating experience. To create Nourish, we started by breaking down the design choices that go into making great kitchen products that you want to use every day. We also began to wonder how we could use those purchases to provide daily necessities for someone else in need.
tagline: Bring more to the table<small>from your kitchen to children in need</small>
description:
What is Nourish?

Our Nourish line of kitchen products can help you prepare your favorite recipes while also providing meals to people in need. We give back a portion of every purchase to the Global Orphan Project to help them supply basic necessities for the children in their care.

The GO Project partners with local organizations to care for children in their own communities.
Nourish purchases help give back to the GO Project's work across the world.

Responsible Design

We noticed that it’s hard to find affordable everyday kitchen goods with the kind of performance that makes you excited about preparing meals, and so we created Nourish. We’ve found that the tools you use can turn cooking from a chore into an art. A perfectly sharp knife, balanced just right, can make chopping vegetables into a craft. To make all of our Nourish products, we researched what makes them perform well, and then sourced top-quality materials to bring our designs to life.

Beyond caring for orphans, the GO Project promotes strong families by creating living-wage jobs for parents.

Giving Back

From the beginning, we knew we also wanted to find a charity partner who could help us give back effectively. When we first met with the GO Project, we were inspired by their commitment to creating lasting change. The GO Project started out in orphan care, but soon realized something surprising. Of the estimated 150 million orphans worldwide today, many were not created by the loss of a parent—they were created by the lack of economic opportunities in their community. One way to keep families together, the GO Project thought, would be to create living-wage jobs in the communities where they were already serving orphans. They also focus on providing education and vocational training for the children in their care as they grow up. We loved the long-term perspective of the GO Project, and we wanted to give them ongoing support by collecting a small piece of every Nourish purchase.

The GO Project also supports at-risk children by helping struggling families cover expenses like school fees.

Learn more about our other charity partnerships and shop the full line of Nourish kitchen tools below.
tileDescription: Nourish brand kitchen tools were created in partnership with the Global Orphan Project, so every purchase helps support their work providing meals and other care to vulnerable children.

name: Weight Gurus
shortDescription: When you’re checking the numbers on your scale each morning, it can be easy to lose track of the big picture of your weight management goals. We wanted to create scales that sync easily to your smartphone, so you can track your measurements over time. We also looked for a way to give back a portion of the profits to protect the well-being of the most vulnerable among us.
tagline: Make a Connection <small>Protect Your Health and Those in Need</small>
description:
WHAT IS WEIGHT GURUS?

When we created Weight Gurus, our brand of smartphone-linked scales, we wanted to find a way to connect your health to the well-being of others. All of our health and wellness brands were built in collaboration with Love146, a non-profit dedicated to ending child trafficking. With your help, we can give back a portion of every purchase to help fight this tragic problem.

It is important to us that we only work with factories that treat their workers well.
Weight Gurus scales are made in a factory in Zhongshan, China.

RESPONSIBLY MADE

Weight Gurus makes connected scales that give back. We wanted to help you collect all your health metrics in one convenient place—on your smartphone, so you can track and plan your goals on the go. We built an app to collect the readings from your scale over time, building up a detailed and constantly updated picture of your health. To bring our designs to life, we partnered with factories that treat their workers well, paying decent wages and maintaining a safe, clean environment on the job. Like everything we make at Greater Goods, we want to make sure that Weight Gurus products contribute to a better world at every point along their journey.

Love146 provides for survivors’ everyday needs, including education and counseling.

GIVING BACK

Next, we went looking for a charity partner who could help us use a part of every purchase for good. When we met the founders of Love146, we were immediately inspired by their approach. Love146 provides long-term care for survivors of child trafficking across the world, creating a community that supports them as they build new lives. Love146 treats every child with dignity, making sure not to take advantage of the tragedy in their stories to attract donations. But they didn’t want to stop with survivor care—they wanted to find a way to end child trafficking for good. Today, Love146 also operates prevention programs that educate children in vulnerable situations about the warning signs of exploitation.

Working with survivors inspired the founders of Love146 to try to end trafficking for good.

We’re passionate about creating products that will improve your life, and sharing a portion of the proceeds with charity partners that can improve the lives of others. Read more stories like this and shop the full range of Weight Gurus products below.
tileDescription: Weight Gurus smartphone-connected scales allow you to track your health goals while also giving back. Both of our wellness brands help support Love146’s fight to end child trafficking.

description:
What is Connect?

You rely on technology to stay in touch with friends, family, and work. Through our Connect brand, we wanted to give you a way to get quality devices and accessories while also helping children in need join supportive communities of their own. Connect was built in partnership with Pathways, an initiative by the Global Orphan Project that helps orphaned teenagers bridge the gap between foster care and the adult world. By providing job training and other resources, Pathways helps these children build their futures.

We partnered with a factory in Fo Shan, China that values treating its workers well.
The Fo Shan team has years of expertise in electronics manufacturing.

Responsible Manufacturing

To make Connect products, we’ve partnered with a factory in Foshan, China that is committed to providing a safe, clean environment and a decent wage for their workers. We chose to work with them because we knew their expertise would help us bring the best products to our community. Our teams both share a desire to make high-quality electronic goods that improve lives.

The GO Project realized that many children leave Haiti’s orphan care system unprepared for the future.

Giving Back

For years, the Global Orphan Project has been working with local partners across the world to care for orphaned children in their own communities. They soon realized, however, that these children often left orphan care programs with little education or job training. When they turned 18, they lost the support of the system without being prepared to provide for themselves. The Pathways program provides two years of hands-on work and life skills training, so teenagers transition out of the foster care system ready to earn a living and be an active part of their community. When you purchase a Connect product, we collect a small part of your order and combine it with hundreds of others to help Pathways prepare children in need for the future.

Through Pathways, the GO Project helps teenagers in orphan care get hands-on job and life skills training.
name: Connect
tagline: Bringing People Together <small>Creating Strong Communities Through Technology</small>
tileDescription: Your devices help you balance responsibilities and maintain strong relationships. Through Connect, we wanted to create high-quality electronics and tech accessories that help you create communities, while helping children in need find their own.
shortDescription: Your devices help you balance responsibilities and maintain strong relationships. Through Connect, we wanted to create high-quality electronics and tech accessories that help you create communities, while helping children in need find their own.
